questions.question: AWS has over 200 services available in the management console.
questions.explanation: AWS offers over 200 fully-featured services covering compute, storage, databases, analytics, machine learning, and more. This is why it can be overwhelming for beginners.

questions.question: What is the recommended first step before deploying any AWS resources?
options: Create an EC2 instance immediately to start testing
Build a solid foundation by understanding AWS infrastructure and tools
Deploy to production right away and learn as you go
Use the most expensive instance types for better performance
questions.explanation: Understanding AWS infrastructure and tools before deploying saves hours of debugging later. Jumping in without basics leads to security risks, unexpected costs, and configuration errors.

questions.question: Which of the following are common mistakes when starting with AWS? (Select ALL that apply)
options: Launching resources without understanding what they do
Using the default VPC without understanding it
questions.explanation: Common beginner mistakes include deploying without understanding, leaving security groups too open, and using defaults blindly. Reading documentation is actually a best practice, not a mistake.

questions.question: Match each learning area with what it helps you understand:
rightColumn: Where to deploy and geographic redundancy
questions.explanation: Regions & AZs determine WHERE your resources run. CLI enables automation. IAM controls access and permissions.

questions.question: Arrange the recommended steps for learning AWS in the correct order:
questions.explanation: First set up billing protection, then understand AWS infrastructure, then learn the tools, and finally deploy production workloads when you're confident.
